item.name: Service Uptime
item.description: Uptime for WWW service

item.name: Anonymous Users/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which users have made anonymous requests to the WWW service.

item.name: Bytes Received/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which data bytes have been received by the WWW service.

item.name: Bytes Sent/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which data bytes have been sent by the WWW service.

item.name: Bytes Total/sec
item.description: The sum of Bytes Sent/sec and Bytes Received/sec.

item.name: Connection attempts/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which connections to the WWW service have been attempted since the service started.

item.name: Copy Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the COPY method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Delete Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the DELETE method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Get Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the GET method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Head Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the HEAD method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Locked Errors/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which requests were not satisfied because the requested document was locked. Usually reported as HTTP error 423.

item.name: Lock Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the LOCK method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Logon Attempts/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which attempts to log on to the WWW service have occurred.

item.name: Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which all HTTP requests have been received.

item.name: Mkcol Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the MKCOL method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Move Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the MOVE method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: NonAnonymous Users/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which users have made nonanonymous requests to the WWW service.

item.name: Not Found Errors/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which requests were not satisfied by the server because the requested document was not found. Usually reported as HTTP error 404.

item.name: Options Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the OPTIONS method have been made.

item.name: Other Request Methods/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that do not use the OPTIONS, GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, DELETE, TRACE, MOVE, COPY, MKCOL, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, SEARCH, LOCK, or UNLOCK methods since the WWW service started. Can include LINK or other methods supported by gateway applications.

item.name: Post Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which requests that use the POST method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Propfind Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the PROPFIND method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Proppatch Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the PROPPATCH method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Put Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the PUT method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Search Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the SEARCH method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Trace Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the TRACE method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Unlock Requests/sec
item.description: The rate, in seconds, at which HTTP requests that use the UNLOCK method have been made to the WWW service.

item.name: Current Files Cached
item.description: Current number of files whose content is in the user-mode cache

item.name: Current Metadata Cached
item.description: Current number of metadata information blocks currently in the user-mode cache.

item.name: Current URIs Cached
item.description: URI information blocks currently in the user-mode cache

item.name: File Cache Flushes
item.description: The number of files removed from the user-mode cache since service startup

item.name: File Cache Hits
item.description: Total number of successful lookups in the user-mode file cache since service startup. The preferred value depends on content. For example, for static content, the value should be high.

item.name: File Cache Hits %
item.description: The ratio of user-mode file cache hits to total cache requests (since service startup). Note: This value might be low if the Kernel URI cache hits percentage is high.

item.name: File Cache Misses
item.description: Total number of unsuccessful lookups in the user-mode file cache since service startup.

item.name: Metadata Cache Hits
item.description: The ratio of user-mode metadata cache hits to total cache requests (since service startup)

item.name: URI Cache Flushes
item.description: Counts the number of URI cache flushes that have occurred since the service startup. Files are flushed if a response is taking longer than specified in the threshold or if a file was edited or modified.

item.name: URI Cache Hits
item.description: Counts the number of successful lookups in the URI cache since the service startup. A low value for this counter is a strong indication that requests are not finding cached responses.

item.name: URI Cache Hits %
item.description: The ratio of user-mode URI Cache Hits to total cache requests (since service startup)

item.name: URI Cache Misses
item.description: Total number of unsuccessful lookups in the user-mode URI cache since service startup. You might want to investigate for issues if this value is high, in combination with a low URI Cache Hits value.

item.name: MS FTP Service
item.description: Microsoft FTP Service

item.name: IIS Admin Service
item.description: World Wide Web Publishing Service

item.name: World Side Web Publishing Service
item.description: World Wide Web Publishing Service

resource.name: IIS - File Cache Hits and URI Cache %
